name: Endless Chase: Fate of Bolek
storyline:
After creating and administrating the Multiverse for millennia, the Cronians lost control of it. Finally, seeing the disorder, they decided to collapse the Multiverse into a single Universe and recreate it later.

As they couldn't decide on the energy they would use to recreate it, they divided into two orders: the Ethereals and the Riddles.

The Ethereals defended pure energy and the preservation of living beings. The Riddles, on the other hand, defended the energy of chaos, even if it caused the death of many living beings.

So the two fought a war and the Cronian essence spread throughout the Universe. The Riddleds were victorious, leaving only one Ethereal, Aeon, the Guardian of Space-Time.

Throughout the Aeons, Aeon is looking for a human being who has a significant part of the Cronian essence scattered around, to train him in order to defeat the representative implanted by the Aeons on Earth, Kodai no Yokan.

Aeon finally meets Bolek, who, for 1000 cycles, is defeated by Kodai.

In cycle 1001, Aeon interferes in Bolek's journey, adding special powers to him.

Thus begins an Endless Chase between Bolek, Aeon and Kodai through the Steam, Cyber and NanoPunk worlds, to recreate the Multiverse.
summary: Endless Chase: Fate of Bolek is a real-time RPG with time travel elements seamlessly integrated into both gameplay and narrative. It features five distinct core loops that alternate, set across three Sci-fi Punk worlds. These core loops, combined with non-linear gameplay and MetroidVania elements, provide players with a sense of freedom, choice, and empowerment, ultimately enhancing replayability.
